content: between seaming like normal one bar from each side and seaming with 2 bars on the hood and 1 bar on the cowl drawstring there are a few options for your drawstring i made my drawstring by knitting i-cord on 2 stitches on size 10 double pointed needles and working until the i- cord was around 40 inches long however if you don t want to work i-cord you can also cast on approx 140 stitches and then immediately bind them off to create a thin strip of knitting or you can cut 3 strands of yarn about 50 inches long and braid them together thread a yarn needle with matching yarn at least when you are done with whatever option you chose twice the circumference of the cowl thread the yarn tail on one end of the drawstring through the eye of a large yarn needle and then use with right sides facing you place edges to be seamed the needle to guide the drawstring through the pouch together see above the seaming will be done in adjust to make sure ends are even tie a knot on mattress stitch and we will work from the center either end of the drawstring seam out to the left and then return to the center and seam to the right this allows for making sure the weave in all ends and block as desired hood and cowl seams are aligned properly beginning at the center seam secure yarn through need pattern support both sides letting half of the yarn hang as a tail to be used later
